alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Howard; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 6:40PM EDT until June 08 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Anne Arundel County in central Maryland... Southeastern Howard County in central Maryland... North Central Prince Georges County in central Maryland... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbia... Severn... Elkridge... Odenton... Laurel... Fort Meade... Savage-guilford... Scaggsville... Ilchester... Linthicum... Jessup... Savage... Georgetown... Hanover... Harmans... Montpelier... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
